info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 17 at 7:16PM EDT until May 18 at 3:09AM EDT by NWS Burlington VT
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Burlington VT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Vermont...
Mad River At Moretown affecting Washington County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mad River at Moretown.
* WHEN...Until late tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, the Mad River begins to leave its banks. Field flooding occurs between Waitsfield and Moretown, and some local roads will flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 9.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening to 4.3 feet tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 315 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT
